Reviews.Title: “Apartment #1 made us feel #1”
Reviews.Author: Derek_Law
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Rue St Honore within sight of the Louvre. One room apartment on the 6th floor but with elevator. Just perfect for a long weekend. Helpful company, welcome bottle of wine, well appointed apartment. Just ideal

Reviews.Title: “Fun to feel like a resident!”
Reviews.Author: StayCurious
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 29 Rue du Temple in the small apartment with loft bed. It was a perfect home for my 13 year old son and me in Paris. The location is fantastic - two blocks from the Seine and The Metro, and walkable to Centre Pompidou, The Louvre, Notre Dame, and the 5th and 6th arrondisements. The apartment was a 3rd floor (2nd floor in France,) walk-up. It was clean, tastefully decorated, and had everything we needed. The beds and linens were comfortable - there is a double bed in the loft and a twin day bed that is a "real bed." We had free calls to the U.S., free wi-fi that was very reliable, and a market right next door! We were glad we brought travel sized shampoos and soaps, etc., but we could have purchased these things easily if we hadn't. There was bath tissue, paper towels, and dish washing soap in the small kitchen. There is also a washer/dryer in the kitchen. The bathroom is very small - common for Europe. But, clean, functional, and the shower was outstanding - great water pressure! We will defnitely book with Special Apartments the next time we go to Paris, which I hope is sooner than later!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay @ Apt #033”
Reviews.Author: chrischye
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Apt 033 Rue De Chapon. Stayed there for 4 nights and the apartment looked exactly as the website projected. Easy booking system and very friendly staff to deal with. The apartment is very Cosy and Nice! It has all the facilites that we need. Our many thanks to our friend in RMC who taken the trouble to go to the apartment block with us to make sure we are able to enter into the apartment. Without him, we will be standing there for a long time. Also thanks to John for being so helpful to make sure that we got our airport shuttle even its a last min request and thanks for the storage too. A truly wonderful experience!. Love the details done for us where to dine and walk and explore! Will recommend to our friends! from your malaysian tenants!

Reviews.Title: “Our first visit, but many more to come”
Reviews.Author: mayday68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at an appartment in St Germain for just a few nights, but found it so much better than a hotel. Our 2-year old daughter loved having the run of a few rooms and we loved being able to put her to sleep in a bedroom so that we could enjoy our evening in the rest of the flat. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Twice with SpecialApartments”
Reviews.Author: BishopOfMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at two apartments, first the Rue Vertbois for two weeks, and recently the Ave Carnot for three weeks. Both were really excellent, and I have already picked this year's apt on the Right Bank. The booking arrangements are very straightforward, and the website clearly describes what you are going to get. When renting in Paris and arriving from Australia, the synchronising of an exact time for your arrival at the door of the apt can be tricky. But Regis and the team generally get this right. The handover of the keys afterwards is also dealt with sensibly I have commeneded SpecialAparments to many of my friends

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartment Close to the Opera House.”
Reviews.Author: holysleep
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating an important wedding anniversary so were were looking for a 'special' apartment in Paris. Indeed, we found one. The apartment at 29 Rue de Gramont was in a great location and just a stroll from the Opera Garnier, Le Madeleine, department stores and numerous cafes and shops. Despite being in the centre of everything, the apartment was very quiet. We were met on time by a representative from Special Apartments who took us on a tour of the apartment and showed us how to work the modern appliances, including a washing machine/dryer combo. The two bedrooms were comfortably furnished with new doonas and each bedroom had a separate marble bathroom. Our daughter came over from London to see us, so having all this room was a bonus. There was another separate loo off the dining room, in the laundry.The kitchen was fitted with all modern stove, microwave and dishwasher and the 6 seater dining room furniture matched the black and gold theme of the furnishings in the large loungeroom. The whole apartment looked thoroughly stylish. A large, widescreen TV came in handy on occasions as it received dozens of channels including English news channels. Free Wi-Fi was included as were free telephone calls to most countries (land line only). By the time we picked up some baguettes, croissants and a bottle of Moet from the Monoprix supermarket nearby, we were starting to feel like locals! The apartment will comfortably accommodate 4 people in 1 queen size bed and two singles. We stayed here for 5 nights and enjoyed the apartment immensely, as well as the buzzy area outside. Contact details: The apartment is at 26 rue de Gramont near the Boulevarde des Italiens. Special Apartments: http://www.specialapartments.com/26_gramont.html

Reviews.Title: “A delight on the Ile!”
Reviews.Author: JayCele
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Special Apartment #030 on the Ile St Louis. The apartment is very comfortable, and well appointed. Access to the bed is a little steep, but the bed is very comfortable. The east end of the Ile is very quiet and peaceful, and I would strongly recommend the apartment over a hotel - same price, but much more space and privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Leena B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at one of the appartments very close to the Louvre with my parents the week before Christmas. Everything went smoothly and we had someone waiting for us to give us the keys and take us through the appartments. The location was fabulous and the kitchen is of a decent enough size to cook couple of light meals if you're fed up with eating out. The beds were very comfortable, and overall we had a fantastic time. The team is great and very helpful. Leena

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: BRROD
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned booking an apartment on line but our experience with Special Apartments was excellent. The business is is a very professional operation. As previously mentioned by other reviewers the staff "go the extra mile". We stayed in apartment 41 on the Ile Citi, next to Notre Dam, very "Parisian" in a great location and exactly as described. Photos truly represent the apartment..Very very clean and lots of character. Cafe downstairs and a bakery just down the street for the mandatory french rolls and pastries for breakfast . Supermarkets close by and numerous restaurants to choose from. Busy during the day and peaceful and safe at night.. Strolling the streets and along the river whilst the Bells of the Cathedral ring in the early evening really completes the French experience. I highly recommend Special Apartments. Congratulations to Regis and his Staff for making our stay in Paris so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Live like a Parisian”
Reviews.Author: Siennagirl
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay with Special Apartments. I accidently booked apartment No 8 not realizing there was no lift and I have a knee problem so stairs are a drama for me. I was dismayed but was it not a problem. We rang Regis he met us there and immediately found two other apartments with a lift for us to choose from. We felt this amazing service when it was our fault. We actually stayed in apt 8 for the first night it is a great apartment in a fantastic spot to enjoy the Montorgueil area with many cafes shops and restaurants. However next day when apartment 41 was available we then moved there. This apt is amazing 2 doors from Notre Dame it felt as if we were actually living life as a local. The apt has everything you could need including a comfortable bed, sofa, great kitchen all looking out to a very quiet courtyard. You look out of kitchen window and can see Notre Dame towers. The bells ring from 8am every day but this was not intrusive. The service we received from Special Apartments from booking to leaving Paris was excellent. We have booked their apartments for other family members who were equally impressed. Could not believe the day we arrived Geraldine arrived with a new shower curtain as they thought the one there was marked it looked fine to us. We are coming back next year and will be booking with Special Apartments again such a professional team.

Reviews.Title: “A honeymoon to remember!”
Reviews.Author: Ailene01
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the staff at Special Apartments were fantastic! They were attentive & really quite lovely to deal with. We found them by doing a search on Google & we were immediately drawn to the number of gorgeous apartments they had on offer. After such a long haul flight, it was great knowing that the apartment was so easy to get to by airport shuttle (bus stop located on the actual street of the apartment) or by Metro/RER. The apartment we stayed at was off Avenue Carnot which was 2mins walk from the nearest Metro/RER. But the icing on the cake: being able to see Arc de Triomphe from our room & being able to walk to Champs Elysees & its surrounds very easily. The apartment was surrounded by fantastic quaint cafes, restaurants, boulangeries & there is even a Monoprix within a short walking distance. There was a lift in the building so it was easy to access our room with so much luggage! The apartment itself was well maintained & as it was managed by La Regence Hotel next door, the rooms were serviced regularly & they even folded our clothes for us! What would make us come back? EVERYTHING! The price we paid was just right, the size & style of the room was elegant, the location is a definite plus & the fact that it was so easy to book! See you guys soon! We look forward to your other apartments in other cities!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rue du vertbois”
Reviews.Author: KatyABee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an apartment for 8 days in a ' Special Apartment' on the rue du vertbois. The apartment was very comfortable and close to transport and the centre of the city. I couldn't recommend it highly enough. We also found the service from Regis, John and Darryl to be very thorough.

Reviews.Title: “The Classiest Way to Stay in Paris (and save money!)”
Reviews.Author: gypsywithalaptop
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous way to live in luxury, save money and experience Paris as a short-term "insider." Through November, I stayed in three different "Special Apartments" -- in Ile St Louis, near Pompidou Center, and near Opera/Quatre Septembre. All were fantastic -- from the swanky furnishings to the appliances, I was wowwed. So were my well-heeled Parisian friends whenever I had them over for soirees. All three apartments were beautifully-appointed, with lovely salons, nice art, great beds, washer/dryers, and one had dishwasher to boot. The kitchens were modern -- and cooking at home saved me a bundle -- and the apartments located near major attractions. Customer service was likewise exceptional. Take a bow, Special Apartments. A very classy enterprise whose apartments I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “feeling good in Paris...”
Reviews.Author: camarotte
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 12 days ina an apartmente at Sentier in Paris which I hired with the people at Special Apartments... it is the second time I use their services. They are very reliable and the pictures at their website are very faithful to reality. Although there was a little misunderstanding regarding the cleaning service , as I thought like the first time I stayed in one of their apartments cleaning service was included... we had a great time and I will definitely use their services again. As we know , hotel apartments in Paris are not very spacious , here you can get all the space , specially if you ar travelling with children.

Reviews.Title: “The place stay out of the crowd”
Reviews.Author: Ovidiu_C
Reviews.Content: Others will visit Ile Saint Louis and dream about it. You will feel the core of the Parisian soul if you chose this charming apartment on Rue Saint-Louis-en-L-Ile. The apartment is quite tiny but this is a characteristic of all apartments in the area. Although, the 2 bedrooms can easly accomodate up to 4 adults. A minus: there is no air conditioner in the attic, so it gets warm in the hot summer days. A big plus: Regis, one of the nicest hosts I have ever met. And the big sensation: the door of the elevator is also the apartment entrance door. You actually step into the elevator directly from your living room. Mmm.... nice!

Reviews.Title: “My Paris”
Reviews.Author: PilgrimPiper
Reviews.Content: Recently I stayed in my third Special Apartment. Each has been unique in style character and ambience, but all have been in sensational locations, and all have allowed me to live the fantasy of being a Parisian - even if only for a few days! My only hesitation in writing this is that the "secret" is revealed!

Reviews.Title: “Special apartments.com : #007, 14 rue Bachaumont, Paris”
Reviews.Author: FlyinOnAJetPlane
Reviews.Content: I agree with the last reviewer on one count: do TAKE EAR PLUGS as the trains do run under this apartment all the time, some trains are louder than others. This did not bother me at all during the day. At night my friend, who was using the VERY COMFORTABLE SOFA BED , slept soundly without ear plugs. Apparently she can sleep through anything! I slept soundly too, but only because I used good ear plugs. The trick with using earplugs is firstly to ensure you have the ones that cancel out most noise and secondly , if using regularly/frequently,to apply Vaseline to them prior to each use. This way they go in more easily and come out more easily, but more importantly you don't get sore ears. It is important to get them right in , hold until they have fully expanded. If you can still hear any noise you haven't got them in far enough. In all other respects this is a FABULOUS APARTMENT.It is VERY COMFORTABLE and has good space. It is in the BEST LOCATION for exploring Paris. I have stayed in many apartments in different parts of Paris and this is the best spot. The company specialapartments.com are the BEST COMPANY TO DEAL WITH. They make everything so easy and are a pleasure to deal with. I am surprised none of the reviews for this apartment #007 on their website mention the NOISY TRAINS though, because it is only FAIR that people should know this prior to choosing their apartment. I would definitely stay here again, WITH MY EARPLUGS. Although I may be tempted to look for another apartment close by that doesn't have trains running under it..... Then it will probably have some worse problem! City Apartment living is seldom quiet. I'll STAY WITH THIS ONE. THANK YOU "SPECIAL APARTMENTS" and especially Regis and Geraldine who made everything so easy. PS the bottle of red wine was DELICIOUS and much appreciated! As was the FREE Wifi and FREE International phone calls.

Reviews.Title: “Great service! Trust these guys!”
Reviews.Author: pjf.yul
Reviews.Content: When renting an apartment in Paris, you have to wonder sometimes about the authenticity of whom you are renting from. It is always better to go through an agency and this was the first year we booked through Special Apartments. Although there were problems with the first place (rue Chapon) we stayed in, Régis and John saw to our every need and arranged for us to get into a different apartment, going out of their way to see that we were happy. This was not easy since it was Easter weekend, but they did it! Trust this organization to make your stay in Paris comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Celestial Apartment on Rue St. Louis en l'Ile”
Reviews.Author: bbradyesq
Reviews.Content: Thanks to our gracious host, Regis Maurin, and his efficient assistant Geraldine, for a lovely, extended weekend in Paris on the Ile St. Louis. This was my 9th trip to Paris, and the third for my wife and one of our two adult daughters. Although we have stayed in lovely three and four star hotels dotting the City of Light, we have never experienced such a "tres ancienne, authentique Paris," at least not quite like this, We felt at home, almost like living in a room at the home of Gaston Lachaille from the film, "Gigi" (which by the way, you can see at the Musee Jacquesmart Andre where many interior scenes, and a few exterior shots, were filmed. And try the chocolat chaud in the museum's tea room...it's divine.) Special Apartment #30, Rue St. Louis en l'Ile, is tucked away in a neat courtyard, one and a half flights up, in a quiet, peaceful enclave. The neighborhood outside is like walking into an Utrillo Parisienne painting. Boulangeries, charcuteries, the original Bertillon Glaces et Sorbet, a few superb restaurants like Tastevin and l'Orangerie, sidewalk cafes, all awaited within a three or four minute stroll of our charming apartment. The 19th Century decor and antique fixtures and furnishings exceeded our expectations created by a phalanx of website photos, which alone are "tres formidable." An original parquet floor, marble fireplace and crystal chandelier, original wood paneling, an easy to operate high def TV, a power shower and washing machine, a great loft overlooking the foyer, dining area and properly equipped kitchen,,,well, again simply look at the photos!! I enthusiatically recommend this experience to those of you who dream of a civilized, quaint and sometimes elusive Paris. For those romantic souls seeking perfection, do not miss it. This review is the best way I know of properly saying "thank you" to the staff at Special Apartments for their memorable gift to my family.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely way to experience Paris!”
Reviews.Author: midwestperspective
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in apartment 8 which is right off the rue Montorgueil. The apartment overlooks a courtyard and was very quiet and comfortable. We also appreciated that it had two separate beds (1 in the bedroom, the other in a sleeping loft over the dining area) rather than a fold-out sofa. The best part was the location; being able to walk down the street to rue Montorgueil and take advantage of the boulangeries, cheese shops, fruit and vegetable markets, cafes and restaurants. What a treat! We received excellent customer service from Regis and the other Special Apartments staff. I would definitely book accommodations with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Magical, romantic Paris could be seen from our bedroom window.”
Reviews.Author: jillian38-9
Reviews.Content: Booking an unseen apartment for the extended family seemed at first to be a daunting task. However the staff at "Special Apartments" were prompt & helpful & all fell into place well. Apartment #037 was comfortably furnished for six people, the beds were warm & comfortable & the welcome basket of goodies was appreciated. The stairs are not for the infirm but the two of us over 70 enjoyed the exercise - the others needed it! I loved gazing out the bedroom window over the chimney pots of Paris to the floodlit Notre Dame. With her gentle flurries of snow, Paris was beautiful. Our apartment was so central we walked everywhere, even though the metro was close. There were numerous small restaurants, a bakery & produce shops & stalls very close by. Unfortunately no special icecream in December! We would definitely use Special Apartments again if we are lucky enough to return to Paris and have already recommended these apartments to friends.

Reviews.Title: “comfort and class”
Reviews.Author: rusanjos
Reviews.Content: We stayed in another special apartment on Ile st louis in October 2010. This one was a little more up market than the one we used last year, but it was well worth the little extra expense. Spacious and comfortable with the best location in Paris. Special apartments are ideal for independent travelers who want to enjoy the city from a comfortable base. The staff are available if necessary but do not interfere at all. Free telephone and internet really appreciated. This is our second stay with Special Apartments and hopefully not our last.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Special”
Reviews.Author: zydeco34
Reviews.Content: Rue Saint Louis Apartment is ok, if you are a student type or on a small budget. It's a great apartment if you want to lose weight and get fit. As there is no lift you must trek the stairs to the 4th floor (in fairness that is mentioned on the website and it replaces the gym workout you’re missing while away from home). The bathroom is a shower curtain over a tiny, tiny wet room (a shower with a very small vanity basin) and has the dimmest lighting imaginable and no mirror. The bedroom has a curtain for a door so sound from anyone up in the living area makes it difficult when sleeping. If someone is using the sofa bed that takes off half the living area which is already overrun by suitcases as you can’t store them in the closet. Metal closets in the bedroom create a din when doors that aren't jammed shut are opened. You have to lean around a jammed-shut door to access the washing machine and there is no light so it is difficult to read the dials to operate it properly. There is no automatic, electric clothes dryer, just a fold out drying rack which you have to place in front of a wall radiator. The ironing board needs a new padded cover and the iron needs an extension cable as it is about 2 feet long. Lighting is dim, very dim, you'll look like a drag queen after putting on makeup because you couldn't see when applying kind of dim. The kitchen area is basic: a bar fridge, a 2 burner induction stove top, a portable toaster type oven which is stacked up high as there is no bench space so difficult to use anyway, a microwave, a drying rack for dishes wired onto a plywood tray which has to be tipped into the sink to pour away water that collects. There are extension powerpoints off one wall point everywhere. Be prepared to buy coffee filters, toilet paper, dish cloths (the one that was there when we arrived looked like it had been used on a floor), facial tissues, salt/pepper (if you eat in), garbage bags, dish liquid, laundry powder. There is no safe. The wifi is really useless. There was an error that another computer had the ip address in use all the time which meant internet access was out. The apartment is well placed for sightseeing. The island is quaint and historic. But I think the expectations set by the lovely photos on the special apartment website do not get matched by the actual apartment (gotta love the wide angle lense). I have ticked I would recommend this place to a friend but you have to be aware of the cons I mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our apartment stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MaccasOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at #41 which is located near Notre Dame Cathedral and we really enjoyed our stay. The view of the cathedral's spire from the kitchen window of the apartment is amazing! No chance of a sleep in as the bells toll at 8am each morning - which was fine for us as it acted as our 'alarm clock' ! There are no supermarkets, boulangeries etc on Ile de la Cite so this means a walk across the bridge to either the Latin Quarter or Ile St Louis to buy provisions. The photos and description of the apartment on the Special Apartments website were very accurate and we found the apartment to be quite spacious by Parisian standards and very comfortable. The bathroom could do with an update as the tiling is stained and this would be the only negative feature of the apartment. The apartment is in an old building and has the traditional wooden floorboards which do creak and can be a bit noisy. Having said this, the adjoining apartments and apartment-dwellers were very quiet and we weren't troubled by noise at any time. Our dealings with the Special Apartments staff were absolutely first rate, from initial enquiries with Hugh who provided very straightforward & easy to follow instructions on after-hours key collection through to phone enquiries with Geraldine, John & Regis who were kind enough to allow us to park our luggage at their office for a few hours while we completed our sightseeing & shopping on our last day. This was our first apartment experience in Paris - we were very satisfied and are happy to recommend Special Apartments.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: person555
Reviews.Content: Although Regis was very helpful with the reservation, it took several phone calls to get a hold of him once we arrived. We rented studio #021 and it was very musty and dirty. The shower curtain was full of mold. The first day someone came to fix something in the shower, which took hours, and was when we wanted to sleep off the jet lag. We were also promised a phone to use, but it was out of credits. My calls to Regis about the phone were not returned. On what was supposed to be a very special trip, we were sadly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: FC331/3
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous going to this apartment as the previous reviews were mixed, but my experience was nothing but pleasant. I had stayed in a hotel down the road on a previous trip to Paris with my wife (Hotel Opera Victoires) and it was lovely, but this time around we have a kid, and he goes to bed at 7pm, so hotel rooms don't really work that well for us anymore as going to bed at 7 in the evening while on holidays is not ideal. I cannot stress how great the location of the apartment is - the Rue Montorgueil is litereally 50 yards away and this is a lovely Parisian street with lots of food shopsa nd a few cafes, so it's so easy to stock up on your essentials or eat out if you prefer. We did the typical French way of shopping on the day of our arrival - bakery, butcher, green grocer, cheesemonger, patisserie for some treats and the wine shop. The apartment itself was well kitted out - there was 6 of everything ( I had read there was only three, so maybe they bought some more) and it's all lovely Villeroy and Boch stuff and was otherwise well equipped with a good fridge, microwave and gas hob, kettle, toaster all easy to use. The apartment was very clean, the bed comfortable. The shower worked well and was also clean (maybe a few small bits of mould about, but not anything that would make you think it had not been cleaned - it was spotless and I had no problem to use it, nor did my wife and neither of us like unclean showers. There was a few small patches of flaking paint (one in the kitchen and one in the shower room), but they were very small and didn't make the place look bad. I actually think they added to the feel of the place - this is an aprtment in a very old building so there will be some things like this that give some character. Most importantly the whole place was really warm and very easy to heat, which was very important to us as it was very cold outside when we were there. There is also a lift, although we could not fit our buggy in it (we didn't bring a small stroller, if we did it would have fitted fine, but instead we opted to bring our big buggy with the thick chunky wheels to make the cobbled Paris streets a little easier on our son and indeed on us psuhing it around). It was the right thing to do. We had to carry the buggy up and down the stairs (two floors), which really was not a big deal at all and didn't bother us at all. In summary, this place was perfect for us as a family to stay. The ability for Specail Apartmnents to have a travel cot there was very convenient. We were abel to put our son down and then retire to the living room in the evening. The metro does pass underneath the apartment and it didn't distrub him at all, and he's a very light sleeper. It's like a gentle roll of thunder every few minutes, I know that must sound awful, but trust me it isn't - you don't even notice it most of the time, even when it starts early in the morning. I would totally recommedn this for a couple to stay or even a one child family - (not sure about more than that though).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time”
Reviews.Author: colindiffer
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time in Paris thanks to the staff at Special Apartments. They were friendly, helpful and the room (in Montorgueil) was amazing. I wouldn't hesitate to use them again

Reviews.Title: “perfectly parisenne”
Reviews.Author: rusanjos
Reviews.Content: We stayed on ile St Louis in a one bedroom apartment in October ( managed by specialapartments.com). The apartment was on the fourth floor with no lift but it was clean and spacious. From the beginning we felt at home in Paris. The location and set up had atmosphere. We became residents not tourists. The location is perfect, we walked to Notre Dame, the Louvre, the Shops and enjoyed the ile de la cite in the early morning before the bus loads arrived. Very close to metro line 7 and Notre Dame RER it was easy to visit anywhere in Paris. The management could not have been better. We were able to check in early ( arrived in CDG at 6am) and they were most concerned about our being disturbed by workmen. We were given the option of another apartment or a200 euro refund for the inconvenience of scaffolding , dust and noise. We will return.

HotelInfo.Name: Special Apartments
HotelInfo.Address: 51 Rue de Turbigo | 75003, Paris, France
